0.subject_description: customer unwilling to run commands and requires an on-site
0.description_description: Issue description: Clearing NVWAM instructions were sent to customer but they insist on an on-site. Resolution: Оn-site and custmer education, closing after no reply from customer. Source: Email from GRS TM Sathya.  From: Narayanan, Sathya Ambati (Service Delivery Manager, NER ISS & Storage (GRSB))   Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 2021 8:43 AM To: HPE Customer Relations  Cc: CSCBNER_Compute  Subject: FW: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Team,  Here the below steps to clear NVRAM is customer procedure, however he is requesting for HPE CE, Please assist in setting customer expectation.   Sathya.A Service Delivery Manager, (NER Compute & Storage) HPE Pointnext Global Remote Services (GRS) Bangalore     Technology Services  Email: sat1981@hpe.com Phone: +91 7259955535  Working hours :  Mon-Fri 13:30 – 22:30 HRS IST ( GMT+ 5:30) Scheduled Absence: NA  The contents of this message and any attachments to it are confidential and may be legally privileged. If you have received this message in error, you should delete it from your system immediately and advise the sender. To any recipient of this message within HPE, unless otherwise stated you should consider this message and attachments as "HPE CONFIDENTIAL“.   From: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov (WIN DL) [mailto:nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com]  Sent: Monday, April 26, 2021 9:41 PM To: HPE Case Management System  Cc: PDL-VAILLANT-GCB-WIN ; CSCBNER_Compute ; Redfern, Andrew ; RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1  Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Hello,  There is no update. I told you already – customer has purchased this device with warranty. How it is supposed unqualified person to open the device and manipulate it? Maybe this is against warranty policy … I don’t know….  Please add next level of support or your manager here. I want to know why there is no option to send technician to perform this activity.   Nikolay Masalski Windows Delivery Lead, GIDC Eastern Europe  nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com  DXC Technology Business Park Sofia 1766 Sofia, Bulgaria  dxc.technology  Learn more about our center: GIDC Eastern Europe      From: HPE Case Management System   Sent: Monday, April 26, 2021 11:18 AM To: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov (WIN DL)  Cc: PDL-VAILLANT-GCB-WIN ; cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; Redfern, Andrew ; RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1  Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Hi Nikolay ,  Greetings from HPE.  This is regarding case :5354805609  Please provide an update on the case.   Regards, Arun Anto Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Narayanan, Sathya Ambati -- sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status / update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided :HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: HPE Case Management System [gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com] Sent: 19/04/2021 06:53 To: nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com Cc: pdl-vaillant-gcb-win@dxc.com; cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com; andrew.redfern@dxc.com Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Hi Nikolay,  Apologies for the delay in response. Please find below the steps:  NVRAM Clear:  This How-to describes, how to clear the CMOS and NVRAM using the System Maintenance Switch on the system board:  power down the server disconnect the power plugs open the server Now you have to identify the system maintenance switch:  At the server cover you can find a plan to locate the switch:  Now change position 6 of the system maintenance switch from the default position “off” to “on”:  Connect the power plugs and power up the server The following message will be displayed:  Maintenance switch detected in the ON position. The system is being default configured. This may take a few minutes… Power off the server and toggle the maintenance switch to the OFF position.  shut down the server and disconnect the power plugs change position 6 back to “off” Connect the power plugs and power up the server  Please use “Reply to All” while replying to this e-mail for continued support.  Feel free to revert back to this mail for any queries  Regards, Biju Sen Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Sathya Ambati Narayanan – sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status/update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided: HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov [nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com] Sent: 14/4/2021 5:13 pm To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com; pdl-vaillant-gcb-win@dxc.com; andrew.redfern@dxc.com Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ] Hello,   Can you please advise us how to do it, as I cannot find related documentation.     Nikolay Masalski Windows Delivery Lead, GIDC Eastern Europe nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com  DXC Technology Business Park Sofia 1766 Sofia, Bulgaria  dxc.technology
0.description_summary: "This case is being reviewed for product quality enhancements. It is mandated that you collect and attach the following error logs:       1. AHS Logs"
0.comment_body_text: Skip Feed  View This Post  Click to collapse post Arun P. anto 28. April 2021 at 10:18 Email To: nikolay-krasimirov.masalski, Windows NCE1, pdl-vaillant-gcb-win, cscbglner_compute, andrew.redfern View Details Actions for this Feed Item Hi Nikolay ,  Greetings from HPE.  This is regarding case :5354805609    Please check the ILO firmware version and update it to latest   Latest ILO firmware :  https://support.hpe.com/hpesc/public/swd/detail?swItemId=MTX_047f7ef0646a437ba21854209a#tab-history  ;  Once updated, please try the steps in the below link :  https://support.hpe.com/hpesc/public/docDisplay?docId=a00030079en_us&docLocale=en_US    Regards, Arun Anto Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Narayanan, Sathya Ambati -- sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status / update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided :HPE Support Case Manager
